entry.title: The Site Now Works
entry.content:
The site now works.

Apparently the issue was a conflict between the name of the Github account: quid-agis, and the name of the repository that was wanted => quidagis.github.io. According to Github Support, if you want to use Github Pages as your personal (User) hosting service, then the username and repository_name must match.

On github.com, edit https://quidagis.github.io -> https://quid-agis.github.io

… 30 minutes later, success.

“Just one little -“

entry.title: First Post From A Simple Jekyll Blog

link.title: First Post From A Simple Jekyll Blog

entry.content:
After a lot of configuring, I have decided to make my own Jekyll based blog,
It is simple, lightweight and has no content except for two brief entries.

I have worked my way through a comprehensive tutorial on installing, configuring
and using Jekyll to create a simple blog. There is no theme, no real structure
just some basic categories and information.

This blog is 100% dynamic 8-)
entry.summary: After a lot of configuring, I have decided to make my own Jekyll based blog, It is simple, lightweight and has no content except for two brief entries.
